pages.text: Once upon a time, there was a kind girl named Cinderella. She lived with her stepmother and two stepsisters who were very mean to her.
pages.imagePrompt: A sad girl cleaning a dusty room while two mean sisters laugh in the background, fairytale style, digital art.

pages.text: One day, a letter arrived inviting everyone to a grand ball at the palace. Cinderella wanted to go, but her stepmother said no.
pages.imagePrompt: A royal invitation scroll on a table, with a castle in the distance, magical atmosphere.

pages.text: Cinderella was crying in the garden when her Fairy Godmother appeared. With a wave of her wand, she turned a pumpkin into a carriage!
pages.imagePrompt: A magical fairy transforming a pumpkin into a glowing carriage, sparkles everywhere, night scene.

pages.text: Using her magic, the Fairy Godmother gave Cinderella a beautiful blue dress and glass slippers. 'Be back by midnight!' she warned.
pages.imagePrompt: Cinderella spinning in a glowing blue gown, glass slippers sparkling, fairy godmother smiling.

pages.text: Cinderella arrived at the ball and everyone stared. The Prince asked her to dance, and they swirled around the floor all night.
pages.imagePrompt: Cinderella and the Prince dancing in a grand ballroom, chandeliers glowing, people watching.

pages.text: Suddenly, the clock struck midnight! Cinderella ran out of the palace, leaving one glass slipper behind on the stairs.
pages.imagePrompt: Cinderella running down palace stairs, losing a glass slipper, clock tower showing midnight.

pages.text: The Prince searched the kingdom. He tried the slipper on every girl, but it didn't fit anyone until he found Cinderella.
pages.imagePrompt: The Prince kneeling to place the slipper on Cinderella's foot, it fits perfectly, stepsisters looking shocked.

pages.text: Cinderella and the Prince were married in a beautiful ceremony. They lived happily ever after, full of kindness and love.
pages.imagePrompt: Wedding scene, Cinderella and Prince waving from a carriage, confetti, happy ending.

pages.text: Jack lived with his mother. They were poor, so he sold their cow for magic beans. His mother was angry and threw them out the window.
pages.imagePrompt: Jack holding colorful magic beans, looking at an angry mother, cottage interior.

pages.text: The next morning, a giant beanstalk had grown into the clouds! Jack was curious and decided to climb it.
pages.imagePrompt: A massive green beanstalk reaching into the clouds, Jack looking up in awe.

pages.text: At the top, Jack found a giant's castle. He snuck inside and saw a giant eating piles of food.
pages.imagePrompt: Jack hiding behind a giant chair leg, giant eating at a huge table, clouds outside window.

pages.text: Jack found a goose that laid golden eggs. He grabbed it, but the goose honked loudly!
pages.imagePrompt: Jack holding a white goose, golden egg on table, giant turning around suspicious.

pages.text: The giant yelled 'Fee-fi-fo-fum!' and chased Jack. Jack ran as fast as he could back to the beanstalk.
pages.imagePrompt: Giant chasing Jack across the castle floor, Jack running with the goose.

pages.text: Jack slid down the beanstalk with the giant close behind. He called to his mother to bring an axe.
pages.imagePrompt: Jack sliding down the green stalk, giant's boots visible at top, mother running with axe.

pages.text: Jack reached the ground and chopped the beanstalk down. The giant fell and was never seen again.
pages.imagePrompt: Beanstalk falling over, large dust cloud, Jack holding the axe.

pages.text: With the golden eggs, Jack and his mother built a nice house and lived happily ever after.
pages.imagePrompt: Jack and his mother happy in a new cottage, golden eggs on mantelpiece, garden in bloom.

pages.text: Three little pigs set out to build their houses. The first pig built his house of straw because it was easy.
pages.imagePrompt: A pig building a house of yellow straw, sunny field, cute cartoon style.

pages.text: The second pig built his house of sticks. It was a bit stronger. The third pig worked hard and built his house of bricks.
pages.imagePrompt: One pig with a stick house, another laying red bricks for a strong house.

pages.text: A big bad wolf came. He huffed and puffed and blew down the straw house! The first pig ran to the stick house.
pages.imagePrompt: A wolf blowing hard at a straw house, straw flying, pig running away.

pages.text: The wolf blew down the stick house too! Both pigs ran to their brother's brick house and locked the door.
pages.imagePrompt: Stick house collapsing, two pigs running towards a sturdy brick house.

pages.text: The wolf huffed and puffed, but he could not blow down the brick house. He was very angry.
pages.imagePrompt: Wolf looking red and out of breath outside a brick house, pigs safe in window.

pages.text: The wolf decided to climb down the chimney to get them. The pigs heard him on the roof.
pages.imagePrompt: Wolf climbing onto the roof, pigs inside pointing up at the fireplace.

pages.text: The pigs put a pot of hot water in the fireplace. The wolf fell right into it with a splash!
pages.imagePrompt: Wolf falling into a pot in the fireplace, steam rising, looking surprised.

pages.text: The wolf ran away howling and never came back. The three little pigs lived happily in the brick house.
pages.imagePrompt: Wolf running away over hills, three pigs high-fiving outside the brick house.

pages.text: Little Red Riding Hood was taking a basket of treats to her sick grandmother. Her mother told her not to talk to strangers.
pages.imagePrompt: A girl in a red hood walking through a forest with a basket, sunny path, waving to mother.

pages.text: She walked through the woods and saw beautiful flowers. She stopped to pick some, forgetting the time.
pages.imagePrompt: Red picking flowers in a sunlit glade, colorful butterflies.

pages.text: Suddenly, a wolf appeared. He asked where she was going. Innocent Red told him she was going to Grandma's house.
pages.imagePrompt: Big wolf talking to Red on the path, looking sneaky, Red pointing down the road.

pages.text: The wolf ran to the grandmother's house, locked her in the closet, and pretended to be her. Red arrived shortly after.
pages.imagePrompt: Wolf in a nightgown in bed, spectacles on nose, looking sneaky, bedroom.

pages.text: 'Grandma, what big ears you have!' said Red. 'All the better to hear you with,' said the wolf.
pages.imagePrompt: Red looking at the wolf in bed, wolf leaning forward with big ears visible.

pages.text: 'Grandma, what big teeth you have!' 'The better to eat you with!' The wolf jumped out of bed!
pages.imagePrompt: Wolf jumping out of bed, mouth open, Red looking scared, action pose.

pages.text: A woodcutter heard the noise and burst through the door. He scared the wolf away with his axe.
pages.imagePrompt: Woodcutter standing in doorway with axe, wolf cowering and running to window.

pages.text: Red let her grandmother out of the closet. They ate the treats with the woodcutter and were safe.
pages.imagePrompt: Red, grandmother, and woodcutter eating cake at a table, smiling, cozy room.

pages.text: The old bank had been closed for fifty years. Legend said a vault inside whispered secrets of the future to those brave enough to listen.
pages.imagePrompt: An abandoned, dusty bank lobby with a massive steel vault door in the shadows, mysterious lighting.

pages.text: Leo and Scale climbed through a broken window. Their flashlights cut through the gloom. The air was cold and smelled of old paper.
pages.imagePrompt: Two kids with flashlights in a dark room, dust motes in the air, exploring.

pages.text: They found the vault. It was slightly ajar. As they stepped closer, a soft, melodic humming filled the room.
pages.imagePrompt: Close up of the vault door, strange symbols glowing faintly, two kids looking awestruck.

pages.text: Leo pushed the heavy door open. Inside, it wasn't gold, but floating orbs of swirling light.
pages.imagePrompt: Vault door open, blue and purple light spilling out, kids silhouetted against it.

pages.text: One orb drifted towards Scale. She touched it and gasped. Images of a beautiful city in the clouds filled her mind.
pages.imagePrompt: Girl touching a glowing orb, holographic projection of a cloud city appearing.

pages.text: Leo touched another. He saw himself in a lab coat, inventing a clean energy source. The vault showed potential.
pages.imagePrompt: Boy looking into an orb, reflection showing him as a scientist, glowing green energy.

pages.text: Suddenly, the vault groaned. The vision faded. They knew they had to leave before it sealed itself.
pages.imagePrompt: Vault door starting to close, lights flickering, kids running towards the exit.

pages.text: They escaped just in time. The vault didn't just whisper; it showed you who you could become if you worked hard.
pages.imagePrompt: Kids outside at sunrise, looking determined and hopeful, bank in background.

pages.text: Neo-Tokyo, 2145. Rain slicks the neon-drenched streets. Kai, a rogue hacker, just intercepted a data stream from the megacorp Chimera.
pages.imagePrompt: Cyberpunk city street at night, neon lights, rain, hacker with holographic interface.

pages.text: The data wasn't just numbers. It was a map to a secret lab deep underground. Kai knew he had to investigate.
pages.imagePrompt: Holographic map projection in a dark room, clutter of tech, focused face of Kai.

pages.text: He bypassed the security drones using a frequency jammer. The lab was silent, filled with tanks containing strange, glowing creatures.
pages.imagePrompt: Stealthy movement past drones, high-tech lab with bio-tanks, glowing blue liquid.

pages.text: Kai hacked the terminal. Chimera was experimenting on them. 'Subject 7 requires extraction,' the screen read.
pages.imagePrompt: Close up of computer terminal code, reflection in Kai's visor, red alert light.

pages.text: One creature woke up. It communicated telepathically. 'Free us,' it pleaded. Chimera wasn't creating weapons; they were imprisoning aliens.
pages.imagePrompt: Alien creature eye opening in a tank, Kai looking shocked, mental waves visualized.

pages.text: Guards approached. Kai initiated the release sequence. The tanks drained and the creatures broke free.
pages.imagePrompt: Tanks shattering, creatures emerging, guards running in through a blast door.

pages.text: Chaos erupted. Kai worked with the aliens to disable the guards. They were powerful allies.
pages.imagePrompt: Kai fighting alongside glowing aliens using tech and powers, dynamic action.

pages.text: They escaped into the night. Kai looked at the city. The real war had just begun, but now he had friends.
pages.imagePrompt: Kai and aliens looking at city skyline from a rooftop, sunrise, hopeful but serious.

pages.text: Page 1: The bell rang at Oak Creek Middle School, echoing through the halls. But something was wrong. Room 4B, Mr. Harrison's class, was completely empty.
pages.imagePrompt: A school hallway with an open door to a classroom, completely empty desks, eerie silence, dust motes dancing.

pages.text: Page 2: Maya, the school reporter, was the first to notice. 'Where is everyone?' she asked. Her best friend Sam adjusted his glasses. 'Maybe a field trip?'
pages.imagePrompt: Two middle school kids standing in the doorway, one with a camera, one with glasses, looking confused.

pages.text: Page 3: 'No trips today,' said Leo, the conspiracy theorist of the group. 'I checked the schedule. They've been erased.' He held up a blank attendance sheet.
pages.imagePrompt: Third kid holding up a clipboard with a blank paper, looking intense, school lockers in background.

pages.text: Page 4: They stepped inside. A half-eaten sandwich sat on a desk. A pencil was still rolling on the floor. It was like they vanished in an instant.
pages.imagePrompt: Close up of a desk with a sandwich and a rolling pencil, motion blur on the pencil.

pages.text: Page 5: On the chalkboard, a single sentence was written in hastily scrawled chalk: 'DON'T LOOK AT THE LIGHT.'
pages.imagePrompt: Green chalkboard with white chalk writing 'DON'T LOOK AT THE LIGHT', ominous atmosphere.

pages.text: Page 6: 'This is barely a prank,' Sam said nervously. But then the lights in the hallway flickered. A strange, low hum began to vibrate the floor.
pages.imagePrompt: Kids looking up at flickering fluorescent lights, shadows stretching long and weird.

pages.text: Page 7: 'We need to find them,' Maya said, grabbing her camera. 'Before whatever took them comes back for us.'
pages.imagePrompt: Maya looking determined, holding camera up, friends standing behind her ready for adventure.

pages.text: Page 8: As they ran down the hall, the school doors slammed suspect. Locked. Note on the glass: 'Testing in Progress. Do Not Exit.'
pages.imagePrompt: School double doors with chains or a digital lock sign saying 'TESTING IN PROGRESS', kids banging on glass.

pages.text: Page 9: 'My theories are starting to make sense now, aren't they?' Leo whispered. The adventure of Room 4B had just begun.
pages.imagePrompt: Leo smiling slightly, spooky lighting, group huddled together planning.

pages.text: Page 10: They had three leads: The Principal's Office, the weird Boiler Room, or the Attic where the old bell tower used to be.
pages.imagePrompt: Split screen or montage of a fancy office door, a rusty metal boiler door, and a trapdoor to an attic.

pages.text: Page 11: 'Let's split up,' Sam suggested. 'No!' yelled Maya and Leo together. 'That's how people go missing in movies!'
pages.imagePrompt: Funny moment, Maya and Leo shouting at Sam, Sam looking sheepish.

pages.text: Page 12: They decided to stick together. First stop: The Boiler Room. Something was glowing green beneath the doorframe...
pages.imagePrompt: Dark hallway, green eerie glow coming from under a metal door, silhouettes of the three kids approaching.
